newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dollar rises to 118.50 yen in Tokyo.
newsitem.headline: Dollar rises to 118.50 yen in Tokyo.

text.p: The dollar surged to hit a key resistance point of 118.50 yen in Tokyo trade on Wednesday, its highest level since March 1993.
It had earlier surged to a new 31-month high against the mark.

Bids appeared to have emerged in an effort to trigger stop-loss buying orders lying in wait near 118.30 yen, with short-covering from 118.40 yen by dealers who had sold earlier in the day also helping to lift the greenback, a dealer said.
Dealers said that having topped the key technical point of 118.50 yen, the greenback was likely to head towards 120 yen.
